item.title: Week 3 Lecture - Parameter Estimation
item.description: Maximum likelihood Suppose we have some sample \(y\) drawn from a parametric distribution and we wish to estimate the unknown parameterisation \(\theta\). Fisher’s MLE proposes we look at the probability of drawing our sample from the distribution conditional on some parametrisation. We call this the likelihood function and write it as \[ p(\bf{y} | \theta) \] For independent draws, this is simply an evaluation of the joint distribution \[ p(\textbf{y} | \theta) = \prod_{i=1}^n p(y_i | \theta) \]
